div.p: [To NN, ... ] of the Memphite (nome) [or in Memphis], [from NN] also called Aristokles, son of Ioul- also called NN, Antinoite. Yesterday ... with the brother ... Titus Pactumeius Magnus, prefect [of Egypt] ... the Alexandrians ... the carriage and me (?) ... Methysion ... they lie in wait waiting for ... with me having addressed ... hereafter first ... he despaired (?) ...
... and of other copies. ...petition(s?) ... Translation: A.P. Hyatt – S. Lash – D.C. Stimson, P.Mich. 21 860
